title: Drawing, "Design for a Sugar Bowl", ca. 1920–40
medium: Pen and black ink, graphite, on verso, white and yellow pastel on cream tracing paper
markings: Stamp: in black ink at lower right: 46
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and black ink at lower center: SUCRIER (C)/DIAMETRE 8 cms/HAUTEUR 9 cms 75; at lower right: JEAN PUIFORCAT/10.41.
creditline: Gift of John Finguerra in memory of his brother Jim Finguerra
description:
Pear-shaped sugar-bowl flared at the top drawn in elevation, with applied scallop-edged lower body indicated in yellow pastel to be executed in ivory. Underdrawing in graphite of sugar bowl in golden section.
Puiforcat collection contains archival photographs  of related coffeepot, Box 8, Folder 1, "Coffeepots," #44.
Puiforcat fabrication #: 44.
